result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE's copy of 12/5/2022 Plea/Sentencing Hearing Notice returned; unable to forward
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Request for Plea Hearing- Atty Cuevas

1:56 PM Defendant Jason M Sutherland in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Jason M Sutherland.  Attorney Robin W Lee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Offer given, Defense asking for a couple weeks to talk with client and then will know if he is taking the deal or will go to trial. Court will follow up in two weeks.

IN CUSTODY 
10:07 AM Defendant Jason M Sutherland by video with  Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Arraignment on August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
DE is in Rock County Jail, court will reschedule ARGN and set up zoom appearance
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court hearing or the conclusion of this case. 
- Defendant shall not be at Menards. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

01:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom from the Rock Co Jail with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
